interesting_fact: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world by both area and population.
China is home to the Great Wall, which is over 13,000 miles long and is the longest man-made structure in the world.
Australia is the only continent in the world without an active volcano.
Iceland is one of the most eco-friendly countries in the world, with almost 100% of its energy coming from renewable sources.
Japan has more than 6,800 islands, but only around 430 are inhabited.
Canada has the longest coastline in the world, stretching over 202,080 kilometers.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
South Africa is the only country in the world to have three capital cities: Pretoria (administrative), Cape Town (legislative), and Bloemfontein (judicial).
Russia spans 11 time zones, making it the country with the most time zones in the world.
India is the world's largest producer of milk, with over 22% of global milk production.
